newsitem.title: JAPAN: Chiyoda declines comment on report on president.
newsitem.headline: Chiyoda declines comment on report on president.

text.p: Plant engineering company Chiyoda Corp declined comment on Tuesday on a newspaper report that its president would resign to take responsibility for the firm's poor business performance.
The Japanese economic daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said Chiyoda President Masaaki Kashiwara would resign in December this year. "We have no comment on the report," a Choyoda spokesman said.
In September, Chiyoda forecast a parent current loss of 17 billion yen for the business year to March 31, 1997, against a previous forecast of a 1.5 billion yen profit.
